Uses of AbstractMessage in messaging
 

Subclasses of AbstractMessage in messaging
 class CarArrivalMessage
          Specifies information about a Car arrival.
 class DoneMessage
          A SimpleMessage which specifies that the simulation is done
 class GateDoneMessage
          Message to announce the fact that a gate is done with its responsibilities, whatever those may be
 class GateMessage
          A GateMessage specifies the location of a Gate in the system.
 class GateSubscribeMessage
          A GateSubscribeMessage is a message which is used to announce to the Traffic Generator that a given actor would like to receive cars The message contains information about the receiver's ip and port
 class ManagerAvailableMessage
          ManagerAvailableMessages specficy that a given manager has come online and is able to receive a paired gate
 class SimpleMessage
          SimpleMessages are messages which simply announce a change in state, they carry no payload
 class TimeMessage
          A TimeMessage announces a new canonical time in the system.
 class TimeSubscribeMessage
          A TimeSubscribeMessage is sent to tell the Traffic Generator that a given actor would like to receive time updates
 class TokenMessage
          A TokenMessage is used to send tokens to a actor within the system
 class TokenRequestMessage
          A TokenRequestMessage is a message sent between gates requesting tokens from their respective dates.
 class TokenRequireMessage
          The TokenRequireMessage is used by Gates to communicate that they need tokens
 class TokenResponseMessage
          The TokenResponseMessage is a response to a token request and used to send tokens between managers
 

Methods in messaging that return AbstractMessage
static AbstractMessage AbstractMessage.decodeMessage(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
          Decodes the message being sent on the given InputStream
 

Methods in messaging with parameters of type AbstractMessage
static void AbstractMessage.encodeMessage(java.io.OutputStream outputStream, AbstractMessage messageWriting)
          Encodes a given AbstractMessage on a given output stream

          Handles the message which was just received by a MessageListener.
 void MessageListener.writeMessage(AbstractMessage messageToSend)
          Writes a message to the socket that this object is listening on
